TopicTitle: Problems if you click launch at end of Construction Basics training

Articles.Content:
April 30 2015

Windows 7 64-bit

Newly installed game

KSP (Steam) version: 1.0.0.830

Mods/Add-Ons: All Stock

When starting a new game after clicking the Launch button at the end of the "Construction Basics" training scenario, the following problems occur when you get to the Space Center view:

1. The camera is in a low position that only lets you see four buildings.

2. You cannot use the right mouse button to control the camera.

3. If you right click the "Research and Development" building it does not show a details window.

4. If you left click the "Vehicle Assembly Building" or the "Space Plane Hangar" you will enter the building, but then you can't get out because the "Exit" button is not clickable. The Esc key does not do anything. You have to close the program using Alt-F4 or the Windows "X" button.

Steps to reproduce the problem:

- Start the program.

- Select "Start Game".

- Select "Training".

- Select "Construction Basics".

- Click "Start".

- Click "Next" then click the command module.

- Click "Next" twice, then attach the fuel tank to the command module.

- Click "Next" once, then attach the engine to the fuel tank.

- Keep clicking "Next" and finally "Done" to close the window.

- Click the "Launch" button. Note: The problems do not happen if you click the "Exit" button instead of "Launch".

- You are returned to the "Start Game" menu (ie. the menu items are: Resume Saved, Start New, Training, Scenarios, Back).

- Select "Start New".

- Use the default options (career mode, normal difficulty) and click "Start!".

- Click "Thanks, I've got it" to close the "Welcome to the Space Center" window.

Fixes/Workarounds:

1. Do not click the "Launch" button at the end of the training mission.

2. Close and restart the program before starting a new game after finishing a training mission.
